question: What is the basic unit of life in all living organisms?
Which gas do plants mainly take in from the air for photosynthesis?
Which pigment gives plants their green colour?
Which organ in the human body pumps blood?
What do we call an animal that eats only plants?
Which organ is mainly responsible for breathing in humans?
Where in a plant cell does photosynthesis mainly take place?
Which part of the body is responsible for thinking and coordination?
What is the main function of red blood cells?
What is the name for the process by which plants lose water vapour through their leaves?
Which kingdom do mushrooms and yeast belong to?
Which organ helps to filter waste products from the blood to form urine?
What is the name of the tough, flexible tissue that cushions joints?
Which part of the eye controls the amount of light entering it?
What kind of biomolecules are enzymes?
What is the name for animals that maintain a constant body temperature?
Which organ in the human body produces insulin?
DNA mainly carries information for which biological feature?
Which structure connects muscles to bones?
Which blood vessels carry blood away from the heart?
What is the term for the change in a species over very long periods of time?
Which organ is responsible for storing bile?
What is the main function of white blood cells?
What do we call a group of similar cells that work together to perform a function?
Which process do living cells use to release energy from food?
Which organelle is known as the 'powerhouse of the cell' because it produces most of the cell's ATP?
What is the term for the movement of water molecules from a region of high water concentration to low water concentration through a partially permeable membrane?
Which blood component is primarily responsible for forming clots?
What do we call the physical appearance or observable traits of an organism?
Which part of the neuron carries nerve impulses away from the cell body?
What is the main function of villi in the small intestine?
In genetics, what term describes an allele that is expressed only when two copies are present?
Which gas is mainly produced as a waste product of aerobic respiration?
Which part of the plant is mainly responsible for absorbing water and mineral salts?
What is the term for a close, long-term relationship between two different species?
Which biological molecule is primarily responsible for carrying genetic information in most organisms?
Which part of the human brain is mainly responsible for balance and coordination?
Which structure in plant cells contains cell sap and helps maintain turgor pressure?
What is the name given to the variety of different species living in a particular area?
Which two systems work closely together to deliver oxygen to body cells and remove carbon dioxide?
In food chains, what name is given to organisms that make their own food using sunlight or chemical energy?
Which structure anchors a plant and allows uptake of water and nutrients from the soil?
What is the term for the maintenance of a stable internal environment in an organism?
Which type of joint allows movement in all directions, such as the shoulder?
What is the name of the tube that carries food from the mouth to the stomach?
Which type of blood vessel has thin walls and allows exchange of materials with body tissues?
What term describes organisms that can tolerate only a narrow range of environmental conditions?
Which structure in a cell controls the passage of substances into and out of the cell?
Which type of respiration occurs without oxygen and produces lactic acid in muscle cells?
What do we call the thread-like structures in the nucleus that carry genes?
Which process describes the formation of sex cells with half the normal number of chromosomes?
What term is used for different forms of the same gene that may produce different traits?
Which part of a chloroplast contains the chlorophyll and is the site of the light-dependent reactions of photosynthesis?
In genetics, what does 'homozygous' mean?
options: Having two identical alleles for a gene
Having two different alleles for a gene

question: Which hormone is primarily responsible for regulating blood glucose levels by lowering them?
What name is given to the functional unit of the kidney that filters blood and forms urine?
Which process describes the movement of molecules across a cell membrane against their concentration gradient using energy?
What is the name of the region on an enzyme where the substrate binds?
Which type of ecological interaction benefits one organism while harming the other?
Which organelle is responsible for packaging and modifying proteins for secretion or use in the cell?
What is the term for the total of all the chemical reactions that occur in an organism?
Which part of the nervous system controls involuntary actions such as heart rate and digestion?
What is the primary nitrogenous waste excreted by humans?
Which molecule carries amino acids to the ribosome during protein synthesis?
What is the term for a group of individuals of the same species living in a particular area at the same time?
Which phase of mitosis involves the chromosomes lining up along the equator of the cell?
In a food chain, which level is usually occupied by organisms that feed directly on primary consumers?
Which type of mutation involves the insertion or deletion of a base that changes the reading frame of the genetic code?
What is the term for an organism's role in its environment, including its habitat and interactions with other organisms?
Which part of a flower develops into a fruit after fertilisation?
Which theory explains how eukaryotic cells may have evolved from prokaryotic cells through symbiotic relationships?
What is the term for programmed cell death, an important process in development and disease prevention?
Which group of plants produces seeds in cones rather than flowers?
Which part of the immune system produces antibodies?
What is the term for the process by which green plants, algae and some bacteria use sunlight to build organic molecules from carbon dioxide and water?
